subtitle: Pork served in a sauce of prunes, apple juice and soured cream.

method.text: Heat the oil and 15 g of the butter in a frying pan until melted. Add the pork and saute for 3-5 min, turning frequently until browned on all sides. Remove from pan with a slotted spoon and set aside.
Melt the remaining butter in the pan. Add the onion and garlic and saute for 2-3 min or until softened.
Add 175 g of the prunes to the pan with the apple juice and ginger. Bring to the boil then simmer gently for 5 min or until prunes are very tender. Remove from heat and leave to cool slightly.
Transfer the prunes and any juice to a food processor or blender and process until smooth. Add the chicken stock, Calvados and season to taste.
Return the meat to the pan. Pour the sauce over the pork and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 10-15 min or until meat is tender.

Blend the cornflour with enough cold water to form a smooth paste. Stir into the pan. Simmer for a further 2-3 min or until thickened slightly then stir in the soured cream. Serve garnished with remaining prunes.

title: Pork Deauville
